relationship_definitions.description: A segment directly follows or addresses attention items or actions mentioned in another segment.
The event described in one segment is directly caused by or results from another segment.
A segment continues discussing the same main topic or expands on significant subtopics previously introduced.
Two segments contrast sharply, e.g., present opposing viewpoints or contradictory information.
A segment clarifies, corrects, or elaborates on unclear or incomplete information from another segment.
A segment explicitly references people, events, or content previously discussed.
A segment provides important context or background information that helps interpret another segment.
